definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Herbivorous animals have very small canine teeth, or none.
sentences.chinese: 食草動物的犬牙很小或者沒有。

sentences.english: This little-travelled region may represent the global nadir for herbivores. As a rule, dishes on the Asian steppes and mountains feature mutton or horse.
sentences.chinese: 這個小旅遊地區裏，食草動物在全球處於最低點。

sentences.english: So how and why did pandas became plant-eaters in the first place?
sentences.chinese: 那麼大熊貓最初是如何成爲食草動物的呢？

sentences.english: The meat of the herbivore is, in comparison, far more edible , smellwise.
sentences.chinese: 相對地，食草動物的肉聞起來要好些，更易食用。

sentences.english: Kangaroos are herbivores, eating a variety of plants, some also eat fungi.
sentences.chinese: 袋鼠是食草動物，喫多種植物，有的還喫真菌類。

sentences.english: This little-travelled region may represent the global nadir for herbivores.
sentences.chinese: 這個小旅遊地區裏，食草動物在全球處於最低點。

sentences.english: Kangaroo is a herbivore, eating a variety of plants, fungi and some food.
sentences.chinese: 袋鼠是食草動物，喫多種植物，有的還喫真菌類。

sentences.english: If he is a plant-eater, he will not hurt me.
sentences.chinese: 如果他是食草動物，他將不會傷害我。

sentences.english: Panda's are classified as carnivores but they mainly have a diet of an herbivore .
sentences.chinese: 大熊貓被歸爲食肉動物，但它們飲食更像食草動物。
